meanings.definition: The act of setting up tents.
meanings.sent1: The tentage at the campsite was done efficiently by the scouts.
meanings.sent2: The tentage for the outdoor event was completed before the rain started.
meanings.sent3: The tentage for the circus was so elaborate that it looked like a mini village.
meanings.sent4: The tentage of umbrellas on the beach created a colorful canopy.
meanings.sent5: The tentage of stars in the night sky was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The amount of space covered by tents.
meanings.sent1: The tentage of the campground was vast, accommodating many families.
meanings.sent2: The tentage of the festival grounds extended across the field.
meanings.sent3: The tentage of the parking lot was filled with cars waiting for the concert to end.
meanings.sent4: The tentage of trees in the forest provided shelter for various animals.
meanings.sent5: The tentage of the desert stretched endlessly under the scorching sun.

meanings.sent1: The tentage of the military base was set up in neat rows.
meanings.sent2: The tentage of the refugee camp housed many displaced families.
meanings.sent3: The tentage of the music festival buzzed with excitement and music.
meanings.sent4: The tentage of the circus performers added a colorful backdrop to the show.
meanings.sent5: The tentage of the explorer's campsite fluttered in the wind.
